title: M4 Mac reviews go multiball! [The CultCast]
description: This week on Cult of Mac's podcast: So ... many ... M4 Mac reviews! Griffin says the new Mac mini and the updated iMac make him go gaga. (via Cult of Mac - Apple news, rumors, reviews and how-tos)
author: Lewis Wallace
excerpt: This week on Cult of Mac's podcast: So ... many ... M4 Mac reviews! Griffin says the new Mac mini and the updated iMac make him go gaga.
text: News Cult of Mac reviewers go hands-on with M4 Mac mini, MacBook Pro and iMac, and we're here to talk about it. Image: Cult of Mac This week on Cult of Mac’s podcast: So … many … M4 Mac reviews! Griffin tells us why the new Mac mini and the updated iMac make him go gaga. And the faster MacBook Pros are no slouches, either. Also on The CultCast: The “updated” Apple accessories — Magic Keyboard, Magic Trackpad and Magic Mouse — pack exactly one new feature. It’s not exactly magical. Apple reportedly plans to launch an inexpensive touchscreen device for managing smart home gear. But what purpose would it serve, really? Apple Music turns its ridiculous 100 Best Albums list into an even more ridiculous $450 coffee-table tome. Listen to this week’s episode of The CultCast in the Podcasts app or your favorite podcast app. (Be sure to subscribe and leave us a review if you like it!) Or watch the video live stream, embedded below. The CultCast live stream archive: M4 Macs reviewed! Our sponsor: CultCloth Get the only cleaning cloth you need: CultCloth! This week’s top Apple news On the show this week: Your host Erfon Elijah (@erfon), Cult of Mac managing editor Lewis Wallace (@lewiswallace) and Cult of Mac writer D. Griffin Jones (@dgriffinjones). Here are the headlines we’re talking about on this week’s show: With the M4 iMac, you don’t have to pick between fast or fun [Review] My MacBook Pro quantum leap from M1 Pro to M4 Pro [Review] Mac mini with M4 Pro is mightier and mini-er than ever [Review] New Apple Magic Trackpad is still the best ever [Review] New Apple Magic Mouse has all the same problems, but Lightning ain’t one [Review] New Apple Magic Keyboard is still a high price to pay for Touch ID [Review] Apple’s next big thing is a wall-mounted iPad? Apple Music turns its 100 Best Albums list into $450 coffee-table book
html:
• News

This week on Cult of Mac’s podcast: So … many … M4 Mac reviews! Griffin tells us why the new Mac mini and the updated iMac make him go gaga. And the faster MacBook Pros are no slouches, either.

Also on The CultCast:

  • The “updated” Apple accessories — Magic Keyboard, Magic Trackpad and Magic Mouse — pack exactly one new feature. It’s not exactly magical.
  • Apple reportedly plans to launch an inexpensive touchscreen device for managing smart home gear. But what purpose would it serve, really?
  • Apple Music turns its ridiculous 100 Best Albums list into an even more ridiculous $450 coffee-table tome.

Listen to this week’s episode of The CultCast in the Podcasts app or your favorite podcast app. (Be sure to subscribe and leave us a review if you like it!) Or watch the video live stream, embedded below.

The CultCast live stream archive: M4 Macs reviewed!

Our sponsor: CultCloth

Get the only cleaning cloth you need: CultCloth!

This week’s top Apple news

On the show this week: Your host Erfon Elijah (@erfon), Cult of Mac managing editor Lewis Wallace (@lewiswallace) and Cult of Mac writer D. Griffin Jones (@dgriffinjones).

Here are the headlines we’re talking about on this week’s show:

  • With the M4 iMac, you don’t have to pick between fast or fun [Review]
  • My MacBook Pro quantum leap from M1 Pro to M4 Pro [Review]
  • Mac mini with M4 Pro is mightier and mini-er than ever [Review]
  • New Apple Magic Trackpad is still the best ever [Review]
  • New Apple Magic Mouse has all the same problems, but Lightning ain’t one [Review]
  • New Apple Magic Keyboard is still a high price to pay for Touch ID [Review]
  • Apple’s next big thing is a wall-mounted iPad?
  • Apple Music turns its 100 Best Albums list into $450 coffee-table book
